page.title: 17HEALTH SERVICE
page.content: WITHERIDGE IS WELL SERVED BY THE HEALTH SERVICE. JUST OFF THE SQUARE IS A DOCTORS SURGERY WHICH WAS BUILT ABOUT SEVEN YEARS AGO. THREE DOCTORS SHARE THE PRACTICE WHICH HAS SURGERIES IN TWO OTHER VILLAGES. THEY COVER A RADIUS OF ABOUT FIFTEEN MILES WHICH INCLUDES A LARGE RURAL AREA TOGETHER WITH FOUR VILLAGES AND A NUMBER OF SMALL HAMLETS. WINTER TRAVEL IS A PROBLEMAND ONE YEAR PATIENTS HAD TO BE TAKEN TO HOSPITAL BY HELICOPTER. THE SURGERY HAS VISITING SPECIALISTS AND RUN A BABY CLINIC. THE NEAREST HOSPITALS ARE AT TIVERTON, BARNSTAPLE AND EXETER. THE BIGGEST PROBLEM FOR THE DOCTORS IS THE LARGE NUMBER OF ELDERLY PEOPLE, A VERY HIGH PROPORTION FOR SUCH A SMALL VILLAGE.
